sun-etal-2023-decoding.title: Decoding the Silent Majority: Inducing Belief Augmented Social Graph with Large Language Model for Response Forecasting

sun-etal-2023-decoding.paperMotivationText: Effectively forecasting responses in news media requires leveraging social dynamics and contextual information surrounding individuals.
sun-etal-2023-decoding.paperContributionText: The authors propose SocialSense, a framework that leverages a LLM to induce a belief-centered graph on top of an existent social network. The task at hand is response forecasting (predicting sentiment based on post history and contextual information about a user). Morality is only used as a feature in the framework.
sun-etal-2023-decoding.paperResultsText: The proposed method outperforms the SOTA in response forecasting, in both zero-shot and supervised settings. In an ablation study, they find that removing the belief-centered graph (which includes morality information) leads to a decrease in performance, so their modelling of morality is helpful in response forecasting.
